name: Residenza Il Villino

reviews.title: An unforgettable combination
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Il Villino for four nights in June and found it to be every bit as enchanting as the reviews we had read. The minute you walk through the huge wooden front doors you enter a quiet, cool oasis and leave the bustle of the city behind. We had the room shown in the brochure; it was large, clean and also had the added bonus of a balcony overlooking the courtyard. The hotel is a real “find” and Sergio and his wife Elizabeth were perfect hosts. Sergio arranged our tickets to the Uffizi and Accademia and also recommended some excellent restaurants, even making our reservations. In all our years of travelling abroad we have never had the good fortune to experience the level of warmth and hospitality that we found at this wonderful hotel. Florence, Il Villino, Elizabeth and Sergio, an unforgettable combination!

reviews.title: 2nd Time Around
reviews.text: For the second year in a row, we stayed at Residenza Il Villino for three nights during the week of Thanksgiving. We returned to stay here again not only because of its great location but most importantly Sergio and Elizabeth's hospitality! They are truly a wonderful couple! Needless to say that we will come back to Il Villino next year!

My mother and I stayed at Il Villino for 4 nights in November and we enjoyed every moment of our short break. The owners are exceptionally friendly and I really can't fault them on anything. Everything was perfect. You can believe all the positive reviews you read here completely.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, great location!!

reviews.text: We had booked a twin room and, to our surprise, were given a whole appartment, I guess because we arrived rather late in the evening and all the rooms were taken. Well, what a magnificent surprise that was! A beautiful 19th century appartment in the heart of Florence!!!! Wow! Furthermore, since it was November it was a little chilly (although luckily sunny every day) and the rooms were always very warm and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Florence

reviews.text: The owners go out of their way to help you with anything. It is far nicer than staying in some anonymous hotel! They speak excellent English, as do other members of staff.
reviews.title: It's a wonderful life!
Loved this place
reviews.text: Wonderful little inn at the heart of Florence. We stayed four nights in March 2005. Great hospitality, good restaurant recommendations, wonderful couple that runs the inn. I could easily live here and will return.

reviews.title: Wonderful stay - Home away from home
reviews.text: My husband and I chose Residenza Il Villino based

on the reviews on trip advisor and we were not disappointed! We were there for 3 nights. Sergio and Elisabeth were so helpful and accomodating. Elisabeth even helped us call our next hotel and change our reservation.
reviews.title: excellent place
Nice place
reviews.text: As Florence is such a small and walkable city, the location is not an issue; while it is a little off the beaten path, it is completely walkable to all the sites, (and I was 20 weeks pregnant while we were there!).
Our room was beautiful and well furnished. Our last night, Sergio had to move us to another room -- which
reviews.title: Great little hotel

reviews.text: It's all true. Residenza il Villino was the perfect retreat in Florence. Situated on a small quiet street, yet close enough to the center of town. 3 blocks from the Duomo, 5 blocks to San Lorenzo Market and Mercato Centrale. If traveling from the train station, and you have luggage, a taxi ride is best. Cost us 9 euros. However, the best asset of this hotel was our host, Sergio. He was so helpful, pleasant and accomodating. He provided us with excellent restaurant suggestions. The breakfast is served in a beautiful room, overlooking the courtyard. Cappucinos made to order. Internet access 24 hours a day if needed. The entire place is spotless. Spotless. Our room was very comfortable, television, mini fridge, nice size bathroom. We were sad to say goodbye. Our next hotel was a dissappointment compared to Il Villino. I believe all hotels from this point on will be compared to Il Villino. It was a joy to stay here in every possible way. If we ever have the chance to return to Florence, we will stay at Il Villino, without question. Hopefully there will be an availability. With these favorable reviews there is no doubt it will fill up quickly. Thank you Sergio!
reviews.title: A most enjoyable stay

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Residenza Il Villino for four nights in early March. We chose it primarily because of the excellent reviews from previous guests and the reasonable price. We can only echo their praise. Room was very nice, breakfasts were fine, and the host and hostess were great. What more could one ask?
reviews.title: Really, Really Nice !
Cozy, romantic, convenient!!!
reviews.text: Residencia Il Villino was labeled by another reviewer as “The best hotel in Italy” so I had high expectations. We (in our early 60s) weren’t disappointed at all!!!! The residencia is a converted convent with beamed ceilings, opening stained-glass windows, cozy furniture, mini-bar, closet and luggage stands. Sergio and Elizabeth, the owners, speak English and are extremely helpful and simpatico. They made our Uffizi and Accademia reservations for us when we reserved the room so we would not have to stand in line at the museums. We stayed in the upstairs Duomo-view room, which was spectacular and very romantic! What a thrill to see the Duomo and the quaint courtyards from the windows. There is no elevator, but Sergio insisted on carrying luggage for us. The bathroom was modern, absolutely clean and comfortable, with all the amenities. The location is perfect for walking to the Accademia, the Duomo, the Uffizi and Ponte Vecchio. Florence attractions are all pretty close. I would recommend a taxi to and from the train station, however, since dragging suitcases over the rough paving stones and narrow sidewalks is not easy, although the distance is not that great. Sergio called a taxi for our departure and it was there in minutes. Breakfast included cereals, meat & cheese, breads, yoghurt, fruit, etc.—not just sweet carbs. Cappucino/espresso made to order. Internet is available in the breakfast room. Hotel guests everywhere should be considerate of other guests and not stomp up and down stairs and shout to each other in the hallway. That was the only noise we heard one night. The Duomo bells ring on Sunday morning at 7 -- an awesome sound. We were there for March spring break, which meant great weather and fewer tourists. There were many groups of young students, but they were enjoyable fellow travelers. We ate at marvelous restaurants even in the touristy Duomo area. I would go back to Il Villino in a heartbeat. What a wonderful, friendly atmosphere – a little haven from the bustle of the Florence streets! My only hesitation in writing this review is that Il Villino will become so popular I won't be able to get a future reservation!
After reading the positive reviews of the Residenza il Villino, my partner and I decided this would be where we would stay for 4 nights in March.
reviews.title: It is all true!

reviews.text: The hotel and our hosts Sergio and Elisabetta exceeded our expectations. They are truly the nicest people you will ever meet. Each evening we asked Sergio for a restaurant recommendation. Needless to say we had 4 incredible meals. All of the restaurants suggested were not on the "tourist circuit".
reviews.title: A wonderful, *wonderful* place.
A welcome retreat in Firenze!
reviews.text: It's hard to add to the glowing remarks about the Il Villino. Let me just say that, yes, everything you've read is true. Elizabeth and Sergio were gracious and welcoming and the villa is extraordinarily beautiful. We had the top room with a full view of the Duomo. The room itself is even better than the photo on the web...very nice bath also. It would have been nice to have a mirror in the bedroom. The courtyard must be wonderful in fine weather.

reviews.title: Our Favorite B&B in all of Italy!
reviews.text: Thanks to our hosts for making email accessible. This was the only hotel in Italy where we were able to get online. Restaurant recommendations were spot-on. One night it was so cold, Sergio even drove us to dinner on his way home.

I will note one thing, though I hate to insert even the tiniest contrary note in my review. A couple of times when it was REALLY cold, we almost wished we were closer to the center. That extra 3 or 4 blocks got awfully cold and dark on those nights. Winter travellers: Stay at the Il Villino, but take a cab back to the hotel after dinner.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We're already planning a return visit in the fall. Can't wait!
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.text: J.B.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Europe

description: Fiftheen Century Property located in the Historical City Centre,among Archeological Museum and Galleria dell'Accademia. Rooms are equipped with private bath with hairdryer, heating, A/C,refrigerator,free ADSL internet connection, and are facing the inner courtyard, far away from the street. Property directly managed by the owner family.
